structure.unit: ARTICLE XXVII. Miami-Dade County TOURIST DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL

law.catch_line: Miami-Dade County Tourist Development Council created; purposes and powers.

text.section:
Sec. 2-249. Miami-Dade County Tourist Development Council created; purposes and powers.
There is hereby created and established in Miami-Dade County, Florida, a nine-member advisory Board to be known as the Miami-Dade County Tourist Development Council (hereinafter referred to as the "Council") for the purposes and with the powers conferred by the enabling act, Chapter 77-209, Laws of Florida. As part of its purpose and power, the council shall prepare and submit a plan for tourist development to the Board of County Commissioners for its consideration.
